title: Campaign Finance - Filings Received by SFEC
description:
A. SUMMARY This dataset lists the current campaign filings received by the SFEC; Campaign forms include FPPC forms 410, 450, 460, 461, 465, 470, 496, 497. Refer to the FPPC page for forms represented in this dataset. Filings of the following SFEC forms are also recorded in this dataset:
  • SFEC161 - Itemized Disclosure Statement for Mass Mailings
  • SFEC162 - Electioneering Communication Report
  • SFEC163 - Member Communication Report
B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Committees file campaign statements with the Ethics Commission on a periodic basis. Those statements are stored with the Commission's provider. Data is generally presented as-filed by committees. C. UPDATE PROCESS Each night starting at midnight Pacific time a script runs to check for new filings with the Commission's database, and updates this dataset with transactions from new filings. The update process can take a variable amount of time to complete. Viewing or downloading this dataset while the update is running may result in incomplete data, therefore it is highly recommended to view or download this data before midnight or after 8am. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Filings received on paper will not have corresponding data in the Transactions or Summary datasets. A "rejected" filing is usually one made in error, under the wrong filing account, or containing an error in reporting period. Amendment filings supersede all transactions from the original filing and any prior amendments. Transactions from prior filings are removed from the accompanying "Transactions" dataset in order to represent the most up-to-date version of transactions. "Filer Name" reflects the name of the committee at time of filing. Committees can change names over time. Refer to the Ethics Commission's webpage for more information. RELATED DATASETS
  • San Francisco Campaign Filers
  • Filings Received by SFEC
  • Summary Totals
  • Transactions

columns.name: Form Type
columns.description: Which type of FPPC form this filing represents

columns.name: Filing Id Number
columns.description: Filing id number ('stamped' on the filing as it is accepted)

columns.name: Filer FPPC Id
columns.description: Committee FPPC Id (aka Filer Id, SOS Id) at time of filing.  May be 'Pending' or blank if the committee has not yet received their id from the California Secretary of State. Check the complete 'Filers' dataset for an up-to-date listing of Committee Names and FPPC Ids.

columns.name: Filer Name
columns.description: Committee name (at time of filing)

columns.name: Filing Date
columns.description: Date the filing was submitted

columns.name: Filing Start Date
columns.description: Starting date of the filing period for the filing (if applicable)

columns.name: Filing End Date
columns.description: Ending date of the filing period for the filing (if applicable)

columns.name: Filing Type
columns.description: One of [Original, Amendment, Correction, Attachment Added]

columns.name: Filing Version
columns.description: Version 1 is original and increments with each amendment

columns.name: Report Number
columns.description: Filer defined number for report (496, 497 filings only)

columns.name: Filing Mechanism
columns.description: How the filings was submitted; Electronic or Paper

columns.name: Has Efile Content
columns.description: Whether the filing content is available electronically. An electronically submitted form will have usually have transaction data. A paper filing will only have filing metadata.

columns.name: Rendering URL
columns.description: URL of PDF rendering of filing, if available

columns.name: Filer Nid
columns.description: Unique identifier for the committee

columns.name: Filing Nid
columns.description: Unique identifier for the filing

columns.name: Filing Activity Nid
columns.description: Unique identifier for the submition of a filing (original, amendment, correction). This field is the primary key for this d

columns.name: Filing DateTime
columns.description: Datestring representing when the filing was submitted. Paper filings are recorded as midnight Pacific time on the filing date.

columns.name: Publish Sequence
columns.description: Netfile publishSequence number

columns.name: Current Status
columns.description: If this filing is superceded, the filingid that supercedes it; if current, the date of the sync update to this dataset; if this field is blank, there was an error during the sync update

columns.name: Redacted Rendering Nid
columns.description: id for redacted PDF rendering

columns.name: Attachments Nids
columns.description: ids for attachment files (496 filings only)

columns.name: Rejected
columns.description: Rejected filings includes those submitted using an incorrect account login or filings which had an error in reporting period. Many rejected filings are subsequently rectified by submitting a revised statement.

columns.name: Sync Status
columns.description: Indicator of sync scripts run

columns.name: Data As Of
columns.description: Date the record was added to source

columns.name: Data Loaded At
columns.description: Date the record was uploaded to the portal

columns.name: Sync Flag
columns.description: Flag used for update process indicating the fill-in process has run

columns.name: Is Termination
columns.description: Is the filing a termination statement?
